messages: a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (01:35): I need some help‚Ä¶ I know I suck‚Ä¶ http://jsfiddle.net/36aag/ So you can see I'm using the boilerplate image replacement class, but now my nav overlaps the image‚Ä¶ floats over the top instead of stays to the side. Which is fine, however, if I adjust nav by doing something like left:150px, then it looks good in all browsers except MSIE 7, which didn't overlap the image to begin with.
a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (01:36): and I'm aware the css is very dirty. I've just been adding and removing parameters just to see how they react in browser.
a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (01:38): And also my sub nav isn't falling back if java isn't supported‚Ä¶  :( Grr..

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (02:06): Quick question on your guys' navigation‚Ä¶ If you have a company logo, that links to index, and you omit "Home" from your navigation, do you guys have the logo as part of your nav list? ie <nav><ul><li><img src="logo.jpg" /></li><li>next item</li></ul></nav>
a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (02:07): My file is setup with the logo being an <h1><a href>Text to be replaced by logo</a></h1> then I begin the nav.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:09): for me the logo link is part of the header but not the navigation list
